The public IP address of the host.
The port the host is listening on.

member.summary: Cache of identities by profile ID. Each profile gets its own unique network identity.

member.summary: Legacy single-identity cache for backwards compatibility when no profile ID is provided.

member.name: F:YARG.Net.LocalPlayerIdentity._sessionId

member.returns: The network identity for this profile.

member.name: M:YARG.Net.LocalPlayerIdentity.CombineGuids(System.Guid,System.Guid)
member.summary: Combines two GUIDs to create a new deterministic GUID. Uses XOR to combine the byte arrays, ensuring the result is unique per combination.

member.name: F:YARG.Net.Packets.GameplayStateBinaryPackets.MinPacketSize
member.summary: Minimum packet size without player name. 1 (type) + 4 (seq) + 4*3 (score/combo/streak) + 1+4+4+4 (SP) + 4*2 (notes) + 4*4 (guitar) + 4*3 (drums) + 4 (band) + 4*2+4+4 (vocals) + 1+4*6 (solo) + 4+4 (sustain/whammy) + 4 (stars) + 8 (time) + 2 (nameLen) + 4+1 (happiness/failed) = 1 + 4 + 12 + 13 + 8 + 16 + 12 + 4 + 16 + 25 + 8 + 4 + 8 + 2 + 5 = 138

member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer
